Content: No, but when it comes to me knowing next to nothing about a decades long field of research I'm inclined to defer my opinion.  In reality, since none of us are tabulating this guy's data or reading geophysics journals, we actually know very little about what he's talking about, either of the models or his criticism.  Our actual opinions on the matter, in this discord, divide not along lines of scientific understanding or logical argument, but along political lines, or, in other words, along tribal lines.

Content:
https://techcrunch.com/2019/02/27/go-jek-get-thailand/
Indonesia ranks fourth in the world's population. 
Only 49 percent of people have bank accounts.

the place where Crypto-finance is really meaningful is the Southeast Asia, Africa, Latin America markets. 
As I remember living in Indonesia, the bank was always far away. 
even in the distance, the waiting time is exhausting.
Companies that have already seen the potential of the market are operating an exchange in Indonesia. 
I think Go-Jek also invested in the possibility.

Author: designer#4893
Content:
Power was religiousized to make the nation believe that the original record had existed and there were no errors in its judgment. 
If a decentralized system, rather than an authoritative third party, confirms the original nature of the records, the nation's authority will lose much of its legitimacy.

the challenge to the monetary monopoly of the country is only the beginning. If we can confirm that the record is original without the intervention of the authorities, the basis of civilization changes.

If you deny this, it is one of the two. 
Whether it's a white lie worrying about the changing upheavals or blindly following the good will of the elites.

Bitcoin will sway existing authority. 
Do you trust the elites or do you look to the future?
You have to choose.
